column3: @fanquake I looked around a bit for APIs we should be using, rather than disabling the functionality completely. I assumed that there would be some calls we could make before/after initiating some network activity (not that it would be useful for us, probably, given the nature of p2p), but I was disappointed in the documentation.\n\nBasically, I would like to know how a network-heavy application _

@theuni It looks the like we'd be using methods out of the [NSProcessInfo Class](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Reference/Foundation/Classes/NSProcessInfo_Class/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/occ/cl/NSProcessInfo).

```
beginActivityWithOptions:reason:
endActivity:
performActivityWithOptions:reason:usingBlock:
```

They allow you to temporarily suspend id

@theuni The problem is not network-heavyness but the CPU heaviness of validating blocks. People complain that app nap slows down the sync due to that. Maybe it could re-enable it after it deems itself up to date.\n
